intro: Mulinum spinosum f. toscae, commonly known as the Tuscan spiny mullein, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its spiny, glandular leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils, thriving in sunny, well-drained environments. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered vulnerable, highlighting the need for its protection.
